1311.17
   901.01 CONDITIONS PRECEDENT TO IMPROVING STREETS.
   No department of the Village shall accept, lay out, open, improve, grade,
pave, curb or light any street or other way, unless such street or way shall
have been accepted, opened or otherwise received the legal status of a public
street or way prior to the effective date of this chapter, or unless such
street or way corresponds in location and extent with a street or way shown on
a recorded plat which shall have been legally accepted by Council.
   901.02 STREET OPENING AND TUNNELING; PERMIT.
   No person other than the Street Commissioner or other authorized Village
employees shall make any opening or excavation in, or tunnel under, any street,
alley, sidewalk or public way of the Village unless a permit to do so shall
have been obtained prior to commencement of the work.
   901.03 CURB CUTTING; PERMIT AND FEE.
   No person shall cut any curb on any of the streets, alleys or public ways
within the Village without first having obtained a permit to do so. The permit
shall be issued by the Building Commissioner and shall be conditioned that the
permittee shall restore the curb to its former condition in the event that the
driveway or other use for which the curb was cut is abandoned or discontinued.
The permit fee specified in Section
1311.17 shall be charged for the cutting of any curbs, which fee shall be
collected at the time the permit is issued.
   901.04 PERMIT APPLICATION.
   Each permit for making a street opening, excavation, tunnel or curb cut
shall be confined to a single project and shall be issued by the Building
Commissioner only. Application shall be made on the form prescribed, giving the
exact location of the proposed opening, excavation, tunnel or curb cut, the
kind of paving, the area and depth to be excavated or cut and such other facts
as may be provided for.
   901.05 BOND FOR OPENING OR TUNNELING REQUIRED.
   Prior to obtaining a permit for the opening in or tunneling under of any
street, alley, sidewalk or public way, the applicant shall furnish the Village
with a bond guaranteeing that the work shall be done to the full satisfaction
of the Village (represented by the Building Commissioner) and that the area
affected by the work shall be restored, as nearly as possible, to its original
condition and such condition maintained, at the cost of the permit holder, for
a period of one year after the completion of the work. However, such bond may
be released at an earlier period if, in the opinion of the Building
Commissioner, such release is warranted. The amount of such bond shall be
commensurate by the extent of the work and shall be determined by the Building
Commissioner, but in no event shall the amount be less than three hundred
dollars ($300.00) for any one project.
   Applicants who because of their operations find it necessary to enter the
Village streets, alleys or public ways at recurring intervals shall be
permitted to furnish a blanket bond with the same conditions as set forth
herein. The amount of such bond shall be determined by the Building
Commissioner, but in no event shall it be less than one thousand dollars
($1,000). However, any project of an extensive nature may be covered by a
specific bond subject to the discretion and approval of the Building
Commissioner as to amount and conditions.
   901.06 PAVEMENT RESTORATION.
   The opening and restoration of a pavement or other surface shall be
performed under the direction and to the satisfaction of the Building
Commissioner and in accordance with the rules, regulations and specifications
approved by the Mayor and Council.
   Upon failure or refusal of the permittee to satisfactorily fill the
excavation, restore the surface and remove all excess materials within the time
specified in the permit or, where not specified therein, within a reasonable
time after the commencement of the work, the Village may proceed without notice
to make such fill and restoration and the bond referred to in Section
901.05 shall be deemed forfeited. If the amount of such services performed by
the Village shall exceed the amount of the bond, the Village Solicitor and
Clerk shall proceed to collect the remainder due from the permittee.
   901.07 BARRICADES AROUND EXCAVATIONS.
   Any person engaged in or employing others in excavating or opening any
street, sidewalk, alley or other public way shall have such excavation or
opening fully barricaded at all times to prevent injury to persons or animals.
   901.08 WARNING LIGHTS.
   Any person engaged in or employing others in excavating, or otherwise in any
manner obstructing a portion or all of any street, sidewalk, alley or other
public way, at all times during the night season shall cause at least two
illuminated red lamps to be securely and conspicuously posted on, at or near
each end of such obstruction or excavation, and if the space involved shall
exceed fifty feet in extent, then at least one additional lamp for each added
fifty feet or portion thereof excavated or obstructed shall be so posted.
   901.09 PROTECTION OF PAVEMENT PRIOR TO UNLOADING.
   No person shall unload any heavy material on the streets of the Village, by
throwing or letting the same fall upon the pavement of any street, alley,
sidewalk or other public way, without first placing some sufficient protection
over the pavement.
   901.10 FENCES OR BUILDINGS OBSTRUCTING STREETS OR SIDEWALKS.
   No person shall obstruct any street, alley, sidewalk or other public way in
the Village by erecting thereon any fence or building or by permitting any such
fence or building to remain thereon. Each day that any such fence or building
is permitted to remain upon such public way shall be deemed a separate offense.
   901.11 MATERIALS ON STREETS OR SIDEWALKS.
   No person shall encumber any street or sidewalk or, being the owner,
occupant or person having the care of any building or lot of land bordering on
any street or sidewalk, permit the same to be encumbered with barrels, boxes,
cans, articles, deposits of snow or ice or substances of any kind so as to
interfere with the free and unobstructed use thereof.
(Ord. 2104. Passed 1-18-78.)
   901.12 DUTY TO CLEAN SIDEWALKS, CURBS AND GUTTERS.
   No owner or occupant of abutting lands shall fail to keep the sidewalks,
curbs or gutters in repair and free from snow or any nuisance.
   901.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter is guilty of a minor
misdemeanor. Any such violation shall constitute a separate offense on each
successive day continued.
CHAPTER 903
Trees
903.01   Definitions.
903.02   Shade Tree Commission.
903.03   Term of office.
903.04   Officers; rules.
903.05   Compensation.
903.06   Quorum.
903.07   Commission as trustees.
903.08   Powers and mission statement.
903.09   Control of trees on private property.
903.10   Treatment or destruction of trees; permit.
903.11   Trees on public property; preservation and removal.
903.12   Trees to be protected during building operations.
903.13   Moving trees; deposit; bond.
903.14   Overhanging trees on public property.
903.15   Overhanging trees on private property.
903.16   Failure to trim; notice; charges a lien.
903.17   Trees on private property; preservation and removal.
903.18   Placing deleterious substances near trees prohibited.
903.19   Use of stone, concrete near trees; permit.
903.20   Electrical contact with trees prohibited.
903.21   Allowing animals to injure trees prohibited.
903.22   Interference with tree care prohibited.
903.23   Permits required.
903.24   General requirements for permits.

public land and trees not recommended for plating on private property.
903.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
Power to regulate shade trees and shrubbery - see Ohio R.C. 715.20
Assessments for tree planting or maintenance - see Ohio R.C. 727.011
Injury or destruction - see Ohio R.C. 2907.44; GEN. OFF.
537.05
Malicious destruction - see Ohio R.C. 2909.02
Weeds - see GEN. OFF. Ch.
549
   903.01 DEFINITIONS.
   (a)   “Public place” means any public street, highway or public park or any
property owned by the Village within the boundaries of the Village.
   (b)   “Tree” mean any tree, ornamental plant, bush or shrub.
 
   (c)   “Forestry” or “tree surgery” includes treating, spraying, pruning and
other kinds of work intended for the strengthening of trees and removal and
prevention of tree pests of all kinds and description.
   (d)   “Village” includes, where appropriate herein, the actions taken in
behalf of the Village pursuant to this chapter, by the Mayor, Council, Village
employees, agents, representatives and contractors.
(Ord. 2390. Passed 4-17-85.)
   903.02 SHADE TREE COMMISSION.
   There is hereby created and established a Shade Tree Commission for the
Village, which Commission shall be composed of six members, five of which who
are residents of the Village and one member from Council. The member from
Council shall be appointed by Council. The five members who are residents of
the Village shall be appointed by the Mayor and approved by Council prior to
the effectiveness of the appointment and shall serve at the pleasure of the
Mayor and Council and may be removed at the discretion of the Mayor subject to
the concurrence of Council. (Ord. 3578. Passed 11-14-12.)
   903.03 TERM OF OFFICE.
   The term of the five members who are residents of the Village on the Shade
Tree Commission shall be for three years. The term of the member of Council
appointed to the Shade Tree Commission shall be for the remainder of his or her
term in Council. In the event that a vacancy occurs during the term of any
member, his or her successor shall be appointed for the unexpired portion of
the term, in the same manner as an original appointment.
(Ord. 3649. Passed 4-16-14.)
   903.04 OFFICERS; RULES.
   The Shade Tree Commission shall elect a Chairperson and a Co-Chairperson
from its members and a secretary who may or may not be a member. The Shade Tree
Commission may adopt rules for the holding of regular and special meetings, the
transaction or disposition of its business and the exercise of its powers.
However, where the general laws of Ohio, and/or Council by ordinance, have
provided for the manner of the exercise of the powers of the Commission, such
procedure shall be followed.
(Ord. 4147. Passed 7-18-22.)
 
   903.05 COMPENSATION.
   The members of the Commission shall serve without compensation or
remuneration but shall be entitled to reimbursement for any and all necessary
expenditures in carrying out the functions of the Commission.
(Ord. 2390. Passed 4-17-85.)
   903.06 QUORUM.
   A majority of the members of the Shade Tree Commission shall constitute a
quorum at any meeting. No action of the Commission shall be deemed taken unless
concurred in by a majority of its members.
(Ord. 2390. Passed 4-17-85.)
   903.07 COMMISSION AS TRUSTEES.
   The Shade Tree Commission may act as trustee for any property, assets or
funds donated to the Village for the care and maintenance of trees, provided
the donor designates or provides for the designation of the Commission as such
trustee. In such an event, the Commission shall have all those powers and
duties necessary to carry out the purposes of the trust.
(Ord. 2390. Passed 4-17-85.)
   903.08 POWERS AND MISSION STATEMENT.
   (a)   The Commission shall have power to study, investigate, plan, advise,
report and recommend to Council or the Mayor any action, program, plan or
legislation which the Commission shall find or determine to be necessary or
advisable for the care, preservation, trimming, planting, replanting, removal
or disposition of trees and shrubs in public ways, streets, alleys, parks or
other property owned by the Village. The Shade Tree Commission also shall have
the authority to grant certain permits as specified in this chapter.
   (b)   The mission of the Bratenahl Shade Tree Commission is to maximize the
benefits of the Village’s urban forest for the environmental, social and
economic advantages it offers to the residents.
(Ord. 3972. Passed 5-16-18.)
   903.09 CONTROL OF TREES ON PRIVATE PROPERTY.
   The Village shall have the discretion to exercise full jurisdiction,
authority, control, supervision and direction over all trees which exist on
private property when any such tree(s) appear to constitute a menace to public
property, public safety or public welfare of the Village. The Village may
receive recommendations from the Shade Tree Commission regarding such trees.
(Ord. 2390. Passed 4-17-85.)
   903.10 TREATMENT OR DESTRUCTION OF TREES; PERMIT.
   Unless employed by the Village or authorized by permit obtained from the
Shade Tree Commission or the Village, no person shall:
(a)    Plant, remove, destroy, cut, prune, fertilize, treat, break, climb,
injure or spray any tree existing on any public place in the Village or
authorize or procure any person to do so;
(b)    Remove or tamper with any device placed for the protection of any such
tree;
(c)    Attach any rope, wire, chain, sign or other device whatsoever either to
a tree or to any device placed for the protection of such tree; or
(d)    Authorize or cause the acts set forth in subsections (a) to (c) herein
to be done.
(Ord. 2390. Passed 4-17-85.)
   903.11 TREES ON PUBLIC PROPERTY; PRESERVATION AND REMOVAL.
   The Shade Tree Commission may determine whether any tree existing on any
public place in the Village:
(a)    Requires trimming so as to insure the public safety or to preserve the
symmetry of the beauty of such public place;
(b)    Should be removed due to its unsafe condition or which by reason of its
location and nature is injurious or threatens injury to other public
improvements in the Village; or
(c)    Should be removed due to being infected with any injurious fungus,
insect or other pest which cannot be otherwise controlled.
   Upon making any such determination, the Shade Tree Commission shall
recommend to Council action to be taken to address any matter as specified in
subsections (a) to (c) hereof. Council may cause the trimming or removal of any
tree by using Village employees or private contractors under contract with the
Village.
(Ord. 2390. Passed 4-17-85.)
   
   903.12 TREES TO BE PROTECTED DURING BUILDING OPERATIONS.
   No person in charge of the erection, alteration or removal of any building
or structure in the Village shall permit any tree upon any public place in the
vicinity of such operation to stand without a good and sufficient guard or
protection as shall prevent injury to such tree arising out of or by reason of
such operation.
(Ord. 2390. Passed 4-17-85.)
   903.13 MOVING TREES; DEPOSIT; BOND.
   All moving of trees upon any public place in the Village made necessary for
the moving of a building or structure or any other private enterprise shall be
done under the supervision of the Shade Tree Commission and at the expense of
the applicant. Such applicant, as one of the conditions to obtaining a permit
to remove such trees, shall deposit with the Village such sum in cash as the
Shade Tree Commission may specify to cover the cost of moving and replacing
such tree if the condition of such permit requires the replacement thereof.
However, in lieu of such cash deposit the Shade Tree Commission may accept a
good and sufficient bond in like amount conditioned upon the payment of the
cost of such moving and replacing. However, if any such project involves the
moving or removal of ten or more trees, authorization to proceed first must be
obtained from Council.
(Ord. 2390. Passed 4-17-85.)
   903.14 OVERHANGING TREES ON PUBLIC PROPERTY.
   All trees standing on any public place in the Village shall be trimmed so
that the branches of such trees projecting over any public sidewalk, private
driveway or into any public street beyond the curb line shall be not less than
nine feet from the ground. The Shade Tree Commission may advise Council of any
trees requiring such trimming so as to conform to the requirements of this
section.
(Ord. 2390. Passed 4-17-85.)
   903.15 OVERHANGING TREES ON PRIVATE PROPERTY.
   All trees or shrubbery standing on private property in the Village and
having branches projecting into public highways or public places shall be kept
trimmed by the owner or occupant of such private property to such an extent
that the lowest branches of such trees or shrubbery shall not come within nine
feet of the ground where they overhang any public walk or driveway.
(Ord. 2390. Passed 4-17-85.)
   903.16 FAILURE TO TRIM; NOTICE; CHARGES A LIEN.
   In case the owner or occupant of such private property neglects or refuses
to trim such tree, upon being notified in writing by the Village to do so,
within the time specified in such notice so as to comply with the foregoing
provisions, after the expiration of the date specified in such notice, the
Village may cause such trimming to be done at the expense of the owner, and the
entire cost thereof shall be a lien upon such premises and shall be billed and
collected as provided in Sections
903.26 and
903.27.
(Ord. 2390. Passed 4-17-85.)
   903.17 TREES ON PRIVATE PROPERTY; PRESERVATION AND REMOVAL.
   Whenever it appears that any tree located on private property within the
Village becomes infected with any parasite, insect, pest or fungus so as to
threaten the scattering of such parasite, pest or fungus to trees standing in
any public place, or when any tree on private property in the Village, because
of decay or other condition appears apt to fall in whole or in part across any
sidewalk or public place, the Village shall have the discretion, with or
without the recommendation of the Shade Tree Commission, to notify the owner or
occupant of such private property whereon such tree exists, which notice shall
order such owner or occupant to spray or otherwise treat such tree or remove
the same in the manner and within the time provided in such written notice. In
the event that such order is not complied with as per the notice, the Village
may enter upon such private property and to spray or otherwise treat or remove
such tree or infected or dangerous parts thereon, and the entire cost thereof
shall be a lien upon such private property and shall be billed and collected in
the manner hereinafter provided.
(Ord. 2390. Passed 4- 17-85.)
   903.18 PLACING DELETERIOUS SUBSTANCES NEAR TREES PROHIBITED.
   No person shall permit any natural or artificial gas, salt, brine water,
oil, liquid dye or any other substances deleterious to tree life to come in
contact with the soil surrounding the roots of any tree upon any public place
in the Village in such manner as to kill, injure or destroy such tree.
(Ord. 2390. Passed 4-17-85.)
   903.19 USE OF STONE, CONCRETE NEAR TREES; PERMIT.
   No person shall place or maintain upon the ground in any public place any
stone, concrete or other impervious material or substance in such manner as may
obstruct the free access of air and water upon the roots of any tree upon any
public place in the Village without first obtaining written permission from the
Shade Tree Commission.
(Ord. 2390. Passed 4-17-85.)
   903.20 ELECTRICAL CONTACT WITH TREES PROHIBITED.
   No person shall willfully cause, authorize or procure a wire or other
conductor charged with electricity to come in contact with any tree in any
public place in the Village in such manner that such tree is thereby injured or
destroyed.
(Ord. 2390. Passed 4-17-85.)
   903.21 ALLOWING ANIMALS TO INJURE TREES PROHIBITED.
   No person shall tie any horse or other animal to any tree in any public
place in the Village, or, having charge of such horse or other animal, allow or
cause it to injure any such tree, or cause or allow such horse or other animal
to stand unattended in such place so that it can injure such tree.
(Ord. 2390. Passed 4-17-85.)
   903.22 INTERFERENCE WITH TREE CARE PROHIBITED.
   No person shall interfere with the Shade Tree Commission and/or the Village,
its employees, agents or contractors while engaged in or about the carrying out
of the provisions of this chapter or the doing of any of the work recommended
by the Shade Tree Commission and/or ordered by the Village to be done
hereunder. Nothing herein shall be construed as an attempt to prohibit the
pursuit of any remedy, legal or equitable, in any court of competent
jurisdiction for the protection of property rights by the owner of any property
within the Village.
(Ord. 2390. Passed 4-17-85.)
   903.23 PERMITS REQUIRED.
   (a)    No person shall hereafter plant or remove any tree or shrub upon any
public way, street, alley, park or other property owned or controlled by the
Village, unless he first shall have obtained a permit in writing from the Shade
Tree Commission specifying the size, type, species and location so to be
planted. Any permit or proposal involving the planting or removal of ten or
more trees on Village property shall also be submitted to Council for
confirmation of the Shade Tree Commission's approval.
   (b)    The Shade Tree Commission and/or Council may deny a permit to any
person who proposes to plant any tree or shrub upon a public way, street,
alley, park or other property owned by the Village of a size, type or species
found to be undesirable for the location proposed; or may deny a permit to any
person who proposes to plant any tree or shrub upon a public way, street,
alley, park or other property owned or controlled by the Village if at a
location found by the Commission to be of a size or type unsuitable for
planting of trees or shrubs or otherwise incompatible with the use of such
property.
   (c)    The Shade Tree Commission and/or Council may deny a permit to any
person who proposes to remove any tree or shrub upon a public way, street,
alley, park or other property owned or controlled by the Village when such
removal does not benefit the preservation of the public health, safety and
welfare.
(Ord. 2390. Passed 4-17-85.)
   903.24 GENERAL REQUIREMENTS FOR PERMITS.
   (a)    The applicant for any permit required hereunder, except the permit
referred to in Section
903.19, and except as provided in subsection (c) herein, shall make application
for such permit to the Shade Tree Commission upon forms furnished by the Shade
Tree Commission specifying the particular kind of work or operation the
applicant desires to perform thereunder. Such permit may be granted by the
Shade Tree Commission upon and after payment of a fee, not to exceed five
dollars ($5.00) per tree, according to a schedule which it may adopt.
   (b)    Such permit shall specify the particular rules and regulations and
specifications pursuant to which the holder of any permit may proceed to do the
work thereunder. Such permit shall be for such length of time as the Shade Tree
Commission shall in each particular case determine, but in no event for more
than twelve months' duration. Such permit shall be revoked forthwith by the
Shade Tree Commission upon proof that the terms and provisions under which such
permit has been issued are being violated.
   (c)    Any proposal or request for permit which anticipates the planting or
removal of ten or more trees shall also be submitted to Council for approval,
if approved by the Shade Tree Commission. Council may grant approval with
whatever conditions and terms attached thereto as Council may deem appropriate.
Council may instruct the Shade Tree Commission, Village employees and/or
contractors to supervise the implementation of any such plan or permit approved
so as to insure compliance with any terms and conditions of Council.
(Ord. 2390. Passed 4-17-85.)
   903.25 NOTICE TO PROPERTY OWNERS; CONTENTS; SERVICE.
   (a)    When notice is given to the owner or occupant of any private property
to carry out any of the provisions hereinbefore set forth, such notice shall be
in writing. It shall state the particular thing which the owner is required to
do and the time in which the work shall be performed. It shall contain a
statement notifying such owner that if the work ordered by such notice is not
done according to the terms of and within the time specified in such notice,
such work will be done by the Village and the entire cost thereof shall be a
lien upon the private property whereon such tree stands.
   (b)    The notice shall also state that when such cost has been ascertained,
the owner shall be billed therefor by the Village and the amount of such bill
shall be payable in cash at the Village Hall within thirty days from the date
such bill is presented, and upon failure to pay such bill the amount thereof,
together with a penalty of five percent (5%), shall be certified to the County
Auditor to be collected with the other taxes for the ensuing tax year.
(Ord. 2390. Passed 4-17-85.)
   903.26 COMPUTATION OF VILLAGE EXPENSE; BILLING.
   (a)    In the event any work on private property ordered by the Village to
be done by the owner under provisions of this chapter is not performed
according to the terms of such written notice, and the Village has caused the
work to be done at the expense of the owner, the Village, at the completion
thereof, shall ascertain the total cost of such work and shall bill the same to
the owner at his address, if it is known, otherwise to the owner in care of any
person living upon or having charge of such premises. If the address of the
owner or any person having charge of such premises is unknown and the premises
is vacant, then the bill shall be presented by posting it in a conspicuous
place upon the premises. Such bill shall be payable in cash at the office of
the Mayor within thirty days from and after the date of its delivery or
posting, as the case may be.
   (b)    In computing the entire cost, if the work has been done by contract,
ten percent (10%) shall be added to the contract price as a reasonable overhead
charge to pay for service of notice, inspection and other incidentals. If the
work has been done by regular employees of the Village, the entire cost shall
be arrived at as follows:
(1)    The time expended thereon by such employee shall be charged at the same
hourly rate that the employee's wages or salary cost the Village, plus the
prorata direct charge for the overhead items paid by the Village.
(2)    The cost of all material and supplies.
(3)    Twenty-five percent (25%) shall be added to the time cost so found as a
reasonable overhead charge to pay for the cost of the Village's equipment,
service of notice, inspection, supervision and other incidentals.
(Ord. 2390. Passed 4-17-85.)
   903.27 COST ASSESSED UPON FAILURE TO PAY.
   The Mayor shall report to Council any such bills remaining unpaid after such
thirty day period, whereupon Council may by ordinance levy the amount thereof
plus a penalty of five percent (5%) as a special assessment against the parcel
of land upon which the tree making such work necessary was located. Such
assessment shall be payable in cash within thirty days of the passage of such
ordinance, otherwise within one year, and shall be certified to the County
Auditor and collected as other taxes. Such assessing ordinance shall be
published for two consecutive weeks by posting copies of such ordinance in the
Village. No other notice need be given except as hereinbefore provided, and no
other proceedings need be taken to make such levy a valid assessment and lien
against such parcel of land.
(Ord. 2390. Passed 4-17-85.)
   903.28 ASSESSMENTS MAY BE COMBINED IN ONE ORDINANCE.
   Assessments against more than one parcel of land may be combined in one
assessing ordinance, provided that the assessment on any individual parcel
shall be limited to the total charge for the work performed on that parcel.
(Ord. 2390. Passed 4-17-85.)
   903.29 PLANTING CERTAIN TREES PROHIBITED IN THE PUBLIC RIGHT-OF-WAY AND ON
PUBLIC LAND AND TREES NOT RECOMMENDED FOR PLANTING ON PRIVATE PROPERTY.
   (a)   In order to prevent damage to persons, property and other public
improvements in the Village, and to prevent the further spread of invasive,
harmful or destructive pests within the urban forest, no person shall
transplant, set out or cause to be transplanted or set out, within the public
right-of-way of the Village and Village owned areas, any tree of the specified
species listed in the Undesirable Tree List/Prohibited Tree Species set forth
below. It is also recommended that Bratenahl residents shall refer to, and
share the list with their landscape contractors, as guidelines for planting on
private property within the Village.
UNDESIRABLE TREE LIST
Prohibited Tree Species
Scientific Name      Common Name        Reason
Acer negundo         Boxelder           Weak wooded, attracts boxelder bug
Ailanthus altissima  Tree-of-heaven     Weak wooded, invasive, messy
Fraxinus spp.        Ash species        Emerald Ash Borer (EAB)
Maclura pomifera     Osage orange       Heavy messy fruit
Populus spp.         All Poplar Species Weak wooded, messy seed set,
                                        susceptible to pest
Robinia pseudoacacia Black Locust       Weak wooded, thorns
Salix spp.           All Willow Species Weak wooded
 
   (b)   In addition to the above titled Undesirable Tree List/Prohibited Tree
Species, tree species not recommended for planting are as follows:
Not Recommended Tree Species
Scientific Name         Common Name           Reason
Acer platanoides        Norway Maple          Short lived, girdling roots
Acer saccharinum        Silver Maple          Weak wooded, heavy seed crop
Betula papyrifera       Paper Birch           Susceptible to pest
Ginko Biloba            Ginkgo (female)       Messy malodorous fruit
Liquidambar styraciflua Sweetgum              Messy fruit
Malus sylvestris        Common Apple          Messy fruit
Prunus serotina         Black Cherry          Messy fruit
Prunus virginiana       Canada Red            Susceptible to pest
Pyrus calleryana        Callery Pear          Weak wooded, invasive qualities
Pyrus communis          Common pear           Messry fruit
Sorbus americana        American Mountain Ash Susceptible to pest, messy fruit
(Ord. 3974. Passed 9-20-18.)
   903.99 PENALTY.
   (a)    Whoever violates any of the provisions of this chapter for which a
penalty is not otherwise specifically provided shall be fined not more than two
hundred dollars ($200.00) for each offense.
   (b)    Whoever violates Section
903.29 shall be fined not more than fifty dollars ($50.00) for the first
offense, and not more than one hundred dollars ($100.00) for any subsequent
offense.
(Ord. 2390. Passed 4-17-85.)

   921.01 REGULATIONS FOR STORING AND PICKING UP OF RUBBISH.
   (a)   The Village is hereby authorized to establish rules and regulations
for the pick- up of rubbish or any item for collection in the Village. Copies
of such rules and regulations shall be available at the Village Hall.
   (b)   No person shall:
      (1)   Place rubbish, recyclables or any other item, other than leaves on
the tree lawn, for collection prior to 4:00 p.m. of the evening preceding the
day scheduled by the Village for collection;
      (2)   Place or pile leaves anywhere but on the tree lawn and leaves may
be placed only on the tree lawn or piled for collection during the months of
April, May, September, October and November at any time;
      (3)   Place rubbish, recyclables or any other item for collection by the
Village if the rubbish, recyclables or any other item was brought from another
location for the purpose of obtaining Village collection;
      (4)   Except as provided by subsection (d) hereof, place rubbish,
recyclables or any other item for collection by the Village at the location of
the Service Department at any time without having received prior written
permission from the Village;
      (5)   Place rubbish, recyclables or any other items for collection within
the boundary of any sidewalk as defined in Section
301.37 hereof or Street, Highway or Through Street or Highway as defined in
Sections
301.42 and
301.43; and
      (6)   Place rubbish, recyclables or any other item for collection
anywhere but on the tree lawn and only during the time periods specified within
this section.
   (c)   Whoever violates any of the provisions of this section is guilty of a
minor misdemeanor.
   (d)   The Village may authorize, by posted or other written notice, the use
of the Service Department facilities for the conduct of a regularly scheduled
recycling program.
(Ord. 3400. Passed 4-16-08.)
