CODIFIED ORDINANCES OF BRATENAHL
 
PART THIRTEEN - BUILDING CODE
TITLE ONE - Adoption of Standards
Chap.
1301.    Residential Code of Ohio for One-, Two- and Three-Family Dwellings.
Chap.
1302.    Registration of Contractors.
Chap.
1303.    National Electrical Code.
Chap.
1305. Ohio State Building Codes.
CHAPTER 1301
Residential Code of Ohio for One-, Two-, and Three-Family Dwellings
1301.01   Code adopted.
1301.02   Conflicts of laws.
1301.03   Board of Building Code Appeals established.
1301.99   Penalty; equitable remedies.
CROSS REFERENCES
Power to regulate building erection - see Ohio R.C. 715.26, 715.29, 737.28,
737.37
Adoption of technical codes - see Ohio R.C. 731.231
Building Commissioner - see ADM. Ch.
145
 
   1301.01 CODE ADOPTED.
   There is hereby adopted by and for the Village, the Residential Code of Ohio
(RCO), as adopted by the Ohio Board of Building Standards, and as published in
Division 4101:8 of the Ohio Administrative Code (OAC), save and except such
portions thereof as may be hereinafter amended, modified or deleted, and shall
apply and be enforced for One-, Two-, and Three-Family Dwellings within the
Village of Bratenahl, except that in the event such Code conflicts with the
Zoning Code of the Village, the Zoning Code will control. A copy of the
Residential Code of Ohio for One-, Two-, and Three-Family Dwellings, is on file
in the Cuyahoga County Law Library. Copies of the Code are available in the
Village Clerk’s office for distribution to the public at cost. A complete copy
of the Code is on file at the Clerk’s office for inspection by the public. The
purpose of the Residential Code of Ohio for One-, Two-, and Three-Family
Dwellings is to provide minimum standards to safeguard life, health, property
and the public welfare. (Ord. 4044. Passed 9-18-19.)
   1301.02 CONFLICT OF LAWS.
   In the event of a conflict between any of the provisions of the Residential
Code of Ohio for One-, Two-, and Three-Family Dwellings, as adopted in Section
1301.01, the stricter standard shall prevail. In the event of a conflict
between any of the provisions of the Residential Code of Ohio for One-, Two-,
and Three-Family Dwellings, as adopted in Section
1301.01 and any local ordinances, resolutions, rule or regulations, the local
ordinance, resolution, rule, or regulation shall control.
(Ord. 3591. Passed 4-17-13.)
   1301.03 BOARD OF BUILDING CODE APPEALS ESTABLISHED.
   (a)   The Board of Building Code Appeals is hereby established. The Board
shall consist of the Mayor, who shall act as chairman, the president pro-tem of
Council, and a resident freeholder of the Village appointed annually by
Council. Minutes of all proceedings and meetings shall be made and preserved,
and such freeholder shall act as secretary. All meetings of the Board of
Building Code Appeals shall be public. Public notice shall be given of hearings
on any appeals from the decisions of the Building Commissioner by the posting
of a notice on the bulletin board in the main entrance of the Village Hall for
a period of at least three days, together with such additional notice, if any,
that the Board of Building Code Appeals shall deem necessary. The Board of
Building Code Appeals shall adopt from time to time such rules and regulations
as it may deem necessary to carry into effect the provisions of this section.
(Ord. 3816. Passed 5-20-15.)
 
   (b)   Any decision of the Building Commissioner made in the enforcement of
this Building Code may be appealed to the Board of Building Code Appeals by any
person adversely affected by such decision. Such an appeal shall be made in
writing within thirty days after the decision is rendered. (Ord. 3931. Passed
8-16-17.)
   (c)   The Board of Building Code Appeals shall determine all matters
promptly presented to it and, where practical difficulties and unnecessary
hardships result from the strict compliance with or the enforcement of the
provisions of the Residential Code of Ohio for One-, Two-, and Three-Family
Dwellings and Part Thirteen - Building Code of the Codified Ordinances, the
Board of Building Code Appeals shall have the power to grant variances in
harmony with the general intent of such provisions and to secure substantial
justice in the promotion of the public health, comfort, convenience, morals,
safety and general welfare of the Village.
   (d)   Council shall have the power to approve, amend, modify or reverse any
decision of the Board of Building Code Appeals if Council finds that the
decision of the Board is not in accord with or is contrary to the purpose and
intent of the provisions of this chapter.
(Ord. 3816. Passed 5-20-15.)
   1301.99 PENALTY; EQUITABLE REMEDIES.
   Whoever violates or fails to comply with any of the provisions of the
Residential Code of Ohio for One-, Two-, and Three-Family Dwellings, as adopted
in Section
1301.01, is guilty of a misdemeanor of the third degree and shall be fined not
more than five hundred dollars ($500.00) or imprisoned not more than sixty
days, or both, for each offense. Unless otherwise provided, a separate offense
shall be deemed committed each day during or on which a violation or
noncompliance occurs or continues.
(Ord. 3591. Passed 4-17-13.)
CHAPTER 1302
Registration of Contractors
1302.01    Registration required.
1302.02    Application.
1302.03    Time and fee.
1302.04    Bond required.
1302.05    Insurance required.
1302.06    Suspension.
1302.07    Stop order.
1302.08    Appeal.
1302.09    Right of the Building Commissioner.
1302.10    Homeowner's exception.
1302.99    Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
Permit fees - see BLDG. Ch.
1311
Licensing plumbers - see BLDG. Ch.
1313
   1302.01 REGISTRATION REQUIRED.
   No person, firm, corporation, general contractor or subcontractor engaged in
performing work in the building trades shall perform any work within the
Village without first obtaining a certificate of registration from the Building
Commissioner. Such work shall include, but not be limited to, dry wall/
plastering, plumbing, electrical, masonry, carpentry, roofing, siding
application, sewer and water installations and repair, heating and cooling,
steel erection, concrete and asphalt placement and repair, excavation,
demolition and moving. For purposes of this chapter, any reference to the
Building Commissioner shall include his designee.
(Ord. 2558. Passed 11-15-89.)
   1302.02 APPLICATION.
   (a)    An application form may be obtained from the Building Commissioner
during normal office hours. The completed application shall be submitted to the
Building Commissioner, together with the bond and proof of insurance required
under this chapter and any other documents requested by the Commissioner. Such
application shall be granted if the Commissioner finds that the applicant is
qualified to perform the work for which the application is sought.
   (b)    Evidence that the applicant is currently licensed by a city or county
with a qualified examination shall be sufficient evidence of qualification so
as to authorize the issuance of a registration certificate, provided no grounds
for disqualification exist. Evidence of repeated violations of the Building
Code of the State or any political subdivision or of any ordinance of the
Village shall be sufficient to disqualify the applicant from receiving the
certificate of registration.
   (c)    The Building Commissioner reserves the right to withhold decision on
the application pending review.
(Ord. 2558. Passed 11-15-89.)
   1302.03 TIME AND FEE.
   The certificate of registration shall be valid for the calendar year in
which issued and shall be renewed annually thereafter. A non-refundable fee of
one hundred dollars ($100.00) shall be paid for registration at the time of
original issuance and at each annual renewal. If an applicant fails to renew
the certificate of registration on or before December 31, a new application
will be required accompanied by a fee of one hundred dollars ($100.00).
(Ord. 4181. Passed 4-19-23.)
 
   1302.04 BOND REQUIRED.
   Each applicant shall furnish a performance bond guaranteeing material and
workmanship in conformity with the Building Code and other laws of the Village.
The bond shall be issued by an insurance and/or bonding company properly
licensed to do business in the State of Ohio. The applicant may furnish a cash
bond in lieu of a performance bond. The minimum amount of any bond shall not be
less than five thousand dollars ($5,000). The bond shall be in force for one
year commencing upon the receipt of such bond. Any bond that is revoked, or
expires without renewal, shall automatically suspend the certificate of
registration until the bond is reinstated.
(Ord. 2558. Passed 11-15-89.)
   1302.05 INSURANCE REQUIRED.
   Each applicant shall furnish proof of a valid and current liability
insurance policy. The minimum coverage of such insurance policy shall be one
hundred thousand dollars/ three hundred thousand dollars ($100,000/$300,000)
for bodily injury, and a minimum of fifty thousand dollars ($50,000) for
property damage. Any insurance policy that is revoked, or expires without
renewal, shall suspend the certificate of registration until the policy is
reinstated.
(Ord. 2558. Passed 11-15-89.)
   1302.06 SUSPENSION.
   (a)    A certificate of registration may be suspended or revoked by the
Building Commissioner for cause, which shall include, but not be limited to,
repeated violations of the Village's building and/or zoning codes, violations
of State and/or Federal laws, environmental considerations, shoddy workmanship,
and/or conditions considered to be a hazard to the welfare, safety and health
of the general community.
   (b)    The suspension and/or revocation of a certificate of registration
under any provision of this chapter shall simultaneously suspend the authority
of any holder thereof to perform any work on any project within the Village.
(Ord. 2558. Passed 11-15-89.)
   1302.07 STOP ORDER.
   Whenever there is a determination by the Building Commissioner pursuant to
Section
1302.06, the Building Commissioner shall issue a stop order and all work shall
cease and desist until the violation(s) are resolved.
(Ord. 2558. Passed 11-15-89.)
   1302.08 APPEAL.
   Any applicant to whom a certificate of registration has been denied,
suspended or revoked by the Building Commissioner may appeal such decision to
the Mayor. If the aggrieved party finds the decision by the Mayor to be
unsatisfactory, the applicant may appeal to the Bratenahl Board of Building
Code Appeals whose decision shall be final.
(Ord. 3816. Passed 5-20-15.)
   1302.09 RIGHT OF THE BUILDING COMMISSIONER.
   The Building Commissioner reserves the right to require additional insurance
and/or bonding if in his opinion the work being performed is of such a nature
that such additional insurance and/or bonding is necessary. The Building
Commissioner may refuse any applicant if in his opinion such applicant is not
qualified to do the work required. Upon refusal of the Building Commissioner to
issue a certificate of registration, the applicant may appeal the denial in
accordance with Section
1302.08.
(Ord. 2558. Passed 11-15-89.)
   1302.10 HOMEOWNER'S EXCEPTION.
   The provisions of this chapter shall not apply to a homeowner desiring to
perform work on his own premises, or a homeowner who desires to assume the
responsibility as his own general contractor, providing that any person or firm
employed for such phases of the work who does this type of work as a business
is registered as provided herein. The homeowner shall submit an affidavit to
the Building Commissioner stating exactly the nature and extent of the work to
be performed by the homeowner himself and by others. Any work performed by such
homeowner and others shall be subject to all provisions of the Building Code
and to all inspections authorized by the Commissioner.
(Ord. 2558. Passed 11-15-89.)
   1302.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provisions of this chapter shall be fined not more than
one hundred dollars ($100.00) for each offense and one hundred dollars
($100.00) per day until the violation(s) is satisfied.
(Ord. 2558. Passed 11-15-89.)
CHAPTER 1303
National Electrical Code
1303.01    Adoption of Code; copies.
CROSS REFERENCES
Electrical wiring permit fee - see BLDG.
1311.16
Garbage disposers to comply - see BLDG.
1321.03(f)
   1303.01 ADOPTION OF CODE; COPIES.
   Under provisions of Ohio R.C. 731.231, there is adopted by the Village, for
the purpose of regulating and safeguarding the use of electricity, electric
installations and materials in the Village, the most recent edition of the
National Electrical Code, recommended by the National Fire Protection
Association and designated as NFPA No. 70, save and except such portions as may
hereafter be deleted, modified or amended. A complete copy of such Code is kept
on file at the office of the Village Clerk, the office of the Building
Commissioner and in the County Law Library. The Village Clerk has copies
available for distribution to the public at cost.
(Ord. 3553. Passed 1-18-12.)
CHAPTER 1305
Ohio State Building Codes
1305.01   Adoption.
CROSS REFERENCES
Power to regulate building erection - see Ohio R.C. 715.26, 715.29, 737.28,
737.37
Adoption of technical codes - see Ohio R.C. 731.231
   1305.01 ADOPTION.
   (a)   There is hereby adopted by and for the Village, the Ohio Building Code
(OBC), as adopted by the Ohio Board of Building Standards, and as published in
Division 4101:1 of the Ohio Administrative Code (OAC), save and except such
portions thereof as may be hereinafter amended, modified, or deleted, and shall
apply and be enforced within the Village of Bratenahl.
   (b)   There is hereby adopted by and for the Village, the Ohio Mechanical
Code, as adopted by the Ohio Board of Building Standards, as published in
Division 4101:2 of the Ohio Administrative Code (OAC), save and except such
portions thereof as may be hereinafter amended, modified, or deleted, and shall
apply and be enforced within the Village of Bratenahl.
   (c)   There is hereby adopted by and for the Village, the Ohio Plumbing
Code, as adopted by the Ohio Board of Building Standards, as published in
Division 4101:3 of the Ohio Administrative Code (OAC), save and except such
portions thereof as may be hereinafter amended, modified, or deleted, and shall
apply and be enforced within the Village of Bratenahl.
   (d)   In accordance with Ohio R. C. 731.231, at least one copy of the Ohio
Building Code, the Ohio Mechanical Code, and the Ohio Plumbing Code as adopted
in Sections
1305.01(a), (b), and (c), respectively, shall be kept on file at the office of
the Clerk, the office of the Building Commissioner, and in the County Law
Library. The Village Clerk has copies available for distribution to the public
at cost.
(Ord. 3554. Passed 1-18-12.)

   1311.01 PERMIT REQUIRED; MINIMUM FEE.
   No wall, structure, building, or any part thereof, shall hereafter be built,
constructed or altered, nor shall the heating apparatus, gas fitting, elevator
works, plumbing, house drains, or electric wiring of any building premises or
structure, be installed, constructed or altered in this Village, except after
issuance of a permit therefor from the Commissioner of Buildings. Before
issuing any permit the Commissioner of Buildings shall collect the applicable
fees as prescribed by this chapter. Unless otherwise stated, the minimum fee
for any required permit shall be twenty-five dollars ($25.00) for a residential
base fee and fifty dollars ($50.00) for a commercial base fee. Where no permit
fee is prescribed by the chapter, the fee for a required permit shall be
twenty-five dollars ($25.00).
(Ord. 2785. Passed 2-15-95.)

        Solicitor or Planning Consultants in reviewing the preliminary
        and/or final plat, improvement plans or any other matter
        necessary for review of a major subdivision.

        reduced to less than five hundred dollars ($500.00), the
        developer shall be notified in writing that the balance of the
        fund must be returned to one thousand dollars ($1,000). The
        Solicitor shall cause the final plat approval to be withheld
        until all actual review costs are reimbursed by the developer to
        the Village.

        incurred by the Village for review and supervision of
        proceedings by the Village Engineer, Solicitor or Planning
        Consultants as well as the costs of notification, advertising,
        court reporting, and any other costs incurred in administering
        proceedings under the Village's Codified Ordinances.
        In making application for any building permit, an applicant
    (2) shall deposit fees as follows to cover actual costs incurred by

   1311.16 STATE BUILDING PERMIT REQUIRED.
   Whenever a building permit shall be required by the State, no permit shall
be issued without the owner first having obtained a building permit from the
State and filing two copies of the identical plans and specifications so filed
to obtain such permit.
(Ord. 2785. Passed 2-15-95.)
   1311.17 COMMENCEMENT OF WORK WITHIN SIX MONTHS.
   Whenever the work for which a permit has been issued has not been commenced,
such permit may be returned to the Clerk for cancellation within six months
after issuance and after a deduction of ten dollars ($10.00) from the permit
fee has been made. One-half of the remaining balance of the permit fee, if any,
shall be refunded. In such case, if the owner has made a deposit as provided in
this chapter, a deduction of five dollars ($5.00) shall be made from such
deposit and the balance shall be refunded.
(Ord. 2785. Passed 2-15-95.)
   1311.18 COMPUTATION OF COST.
   Where the permit fee is based on the cost of the work done under the permit,
such cost shall be the actual cost as certified by the owner, or his authorized
representative, and as approved by the Clerk. The Clerk may, at any time within
the 120 days after the final inspection, require the submission of invoices and
other proof to substantiate the estimated cost stated in the application, and
the Clerk shall require the payment of additional fees if it is demonstrated
and found that the actual cost of the work is in excess of the estimated cost
upon which the permit fees were based.
(Ord. 2785. Passed 2-15-95.)
   1311.19 DETERMINATION OF FLOOR AREA.
   The aggregate floor area in the determination of permit fees shall be the
sum of the gross horizontal area of the several floors, including basement,
cellar and attic. All horizontal dimensions shall be taken from the exterior
faces of walls.
(Ord. 2785. Passed 2-15-95.)
